quote_last: on the same Tuesday before George Chandler-Powell had finished his list of private patients at St. Angela’s Hospital. Pulling off his operating gown, he felt paradoxically both exhausted and restless.
title: The Private Patient
author: P.D. James

quote_first: Having to change ’buses, I allowed plenty of time — in fact, too much; for we arrived at
quote_last: , and Franching, so the servant said, had only just gone up to dress.
title: Diary of a Nobody
author: George and Weedon Grossmith
